raw: * The virtual tree can be used to render node and leafs. Nodes and leafs are
* both items for a tree. The difference between a node and a leaf is that a
* node has child items, but a leaf not.
* With the {@link qx.ui.tree.core.IVirtualTreeDelegate} interface it is possible
* to configure the tree's behavior (item renderer configuration, etc.).
* Here's an example of how to use the widget, including using a model
* property to open/close branches. See the two timers at the end. The first
* one opens all branches after two seconds; the second cleans up the tree
*   // convert the raw nodes to qooxdoo objects
*   // create the tree and synchronize the model property 'open'
*   // After two seconds, open up all branches by setting their open
*   // After five seconds, remove and dispose the tree.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Virtual tree implementation. The virtual tree can be used to render node and leafs. Nodes and leafs are both items for a tree. The difference between a node and a leaf is that a node has child items, but a leaf not. With the {@link qx.ui.tree.core.IVirtualTreeDelegate} interface it is possible to configure the tree's behavior (item renderer configuration, etc.). Here's an example of how to use the widget, including using a model property to open/close branches. See the two timers at the end. The first one opens all branches after two seconds; the second cleans up the tree after five seconds. 

   var nodes =
   [
     {
       name : "Root",
       open : false,
       children :
       [
         {
           name : "Branch 1",
           open : false,
           children :
           [
             {
               name : "Leaf 1.1"
             },
             {
               name : "Leaf 1.2"
             },
             {
               name : "Branch 1.3",
               open : false,
               children :
               [
                 {
                   name : "Branch 1.3.1",
                   open : false,
                   children :
                   [
                     {
                       name : "Leaf 1.3.1.1"
                     }
                   ]
                 }
               ]
             }
           ]
         }
       ]
     }
   ];

   nodes = qx.data.marshal.Json.createModel(nodes, true);


   var tree =
     new qx.ui.tree.VirtualTree(
       nodes.getItem(0), "name", "children", "open").set({
         width : 200,
         height : 400
       });

   tree.getSelection().addListener("change", function(e) {
     this.debug("Selection: " + tree.getSelection().getItem(0).getName());
   }, this);
   tree.set(
     {
       width : 200,
       height : 400,
       showTopLevelOpenCloseIcons : true
     });
   var doc = this.getRoot();
   doc.add(tree,
   {
     left : 100,
     top  : 50
   });


   qx.event.Timer.once(
     function()
     {
       ;(function allOpen(root)
         {
           if (root.setOpen)     root.setOpen(true);
           if (root.getChildren) root.getChildren().forEach(allOpen);
         })(nodes.getItem(0));
     },
     this,
     2000);

   qx.event.Timer.once(
     function()
     {
       doc.remove(tree);
       tree.dispose();
       console.warn("All cleaned up.");
     },
     this,
     5000);

raw: * The 'contentPadding' property is a shorthand property for setting 'contentPaddingTop',
* If four values are specified they apply to top, right, bottom and left respectively.
* If there is only one value, it applies to all sides, if there are two or three,
* the missing values are taken from the opposite side.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The 'contentPadding' property is a shorthand property for setting 'contentPaddingTop', 'contentPaddingRight', 'contentPaddingBottom' and 'contentPaddingLeft' at the same time. If four values are specified they apply to top, right, bottom and left respectively. If there is only one value, it applies to all sides, if there are two or three, the missing values are taken from the opposite side.

raw: * Helper method to get all visible children form the passed parent node.
* The algorithm implements a depth-first search with a complexity:
* @param node {qx.core.Object} The start node to start search.
* @param nestedLevel {Integer} The nested level from the start node.
* @return {Array} All visible children form the parent.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper method to get all visible children form the passed parent node. The algorithm implements a depth-first search with a complexity: O(n) and n are all visible items.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: node {qx.core.Object} The start node to start search.
@param.description: The start node to start search.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: nestedLevel {Integer} The nested level from the start node.
@param.description: The nested level from the start node.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Array} All visible children form the parent.
@return.description: All visible children form the parent.
